medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Husband noticed increased slowness of speech and lethargy for 1 day; on the day of admission, the patient was somnolent. Symptoms included recent back pain and diarrhea for 1 week. Admitted with lethargy, and initial vitals showed decreased alertness, jaundice, and abdominal cramps.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1) L parietal meningioma stable in size for years 2) Seizure disorder 3) Wegeners granulomatosis with mild renal insufficiency 4) Pulmonary embolism with RH strain and bilateral DVTs, s/p IVC filter, on coumadin 5) Chronic renal insufficiency stage III 6) Mild aortic valve stenosis 7) HTN 8) Hyperlipidemia 9) Alcoholic hepatitis in past 10) Hypothyroidism 11) Hyperparathyroidism due to renal failure 12) Gout 13) Myoclonal gammopathy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and Father deceased. No history of seizures or autoimmune disease.
